concept.title: Configuring EBS for Data Services and Droplets

conbody.p: The default set of disks in an EC2 instance is limited: root volumes are small and the disk mounted on /mnt is ephemeral. stores its services data on the root filesystem. The size of the ephemeral disk varies by the instance type.
It is recommended to check EC2 instances for disk utilization. In the following example, the root file system is almost half-full on a new, medium instance:
conbody.screen: @hcf-7tgy:~$ df-h Filesystem Size Used Avail Use% Mounted on /dev/sda1 7.9G 3.3G 4.3G 43% / none 3.7G 112K 3.7G 1% /dev none 3.8G 0 3.8G 0% /dev/shm none 3.8G 80K 3.8G 1% /var/run none 3.8G 0 3.8G 0% /var/lock none 3.8G 0 3.8G 0% /lib/init/rw /dev/sdb 414G 199M 393G 1% /mnt
conbody.p: You can create a more robust instance by moving the service data and droplets onto an Amazon EBS (Elastic Block Store) volume.
